parameters.info: Input skymodel
parameters.name: input-skymodel

parameters.info: Output skymodel
parameters.name: output-skymodel

parameters.info: Append this model to input-skymodel, then write to output-skymodel
parameters.name: append

parameters.info: Forces overwrite of output model.
parameters.name: force

parameters.info: Input model type
parameters.name: type

parameters.info: Output model type.
parameters.name: output-type

parameters.info: Append another model to input model. May be given multiple times. --append-type=TYPE  Appended model type (Tigger, ASCII, BBS, NEWSTAR, AIPSCC, AIPSCCFITS, Gaul, auto). Default is none.
parameters.name: append-type

parameters.info: Input format, for ASCII or BBS tables. For ASCII tables, default is 'name ra_h ra_m ra_s dec_d dec_m dec_s i q u v spi rm emaj_s emin_s pa_d freq0 tags...'. For BBS tables, the default format is specified in the file header.
parameters.name: format

parameters.info: Format of appended file, for ASCII or BBS tables. Default is to use 'format'.
parameters.name: append-format

parameters.info: Output format, for ASCII or BBS tables. If the model was originally imported from an ASCII or BBS table, the default output format will be the same as the original format.
parameters.name: output-format

parameters.info: Prints help on format strings.
parameters.name: help-format

parameters.info: Minimal source extent, when importing NEWSTAR or ASCII files. Sources with a smaller extent will be treated as point sources.
parameters.name: min-extent

parameters.info: Extract sources with the specified tags.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.info: Selects a subset of sources by comparing the named TAG to a float VALUE. '<>' represents the comparison operator, and can be one of == (or =),!=,<=,<,>,>=. Alternatively, you may use the FORTRAN-style operators .eq.,.ne.,.le.,.lt.,.gt.,.ge. Multiple select options may be given, in which case the effect is a logical- AND. Note that VALUE may be followed by one of the characters d, m or s, in which case it will be converted from degrees, minutes or seconds into radians. This is useful for selections such as 'r<5d'. 'remove-nans' Removes the named source(s) from the model. NAME may contain * and ? wildcards.
parameters.name: select

parameters.info: Treat fluxes as apparent, and rescale them into intrinsic using the supplied primary beam model (see 'primary-beam' option).
parameters.name: app-to-int

parameters.info: Treat fluxes as intrinsic, and rescale them into apparent using the supplied primary beam model (see 'primary-beam' option).
parameters.name: int-to-app

parameters.info: Convert NEWSTAR apparent fluxes in input model to intrinsic. Only works for NEWSTAR or NEWSTAR-derived input models.
parameters.name: newstar-app-to-int

parameters.info: Convert NEWSTAR intrinsic fluxes in input model to apparent. Only works for NEWSTAR or NEWSTAR-derived input models.
parameters.name: newstar-int-to-app

parameters.info: Override coordinates of the nominal field center specified in the input model. Use the form 'Xdeg,Ydeg' or 'Xdeg,Yrad' to specify RA,Dec in degrees or radians, or else a a pyrap.measures direction string of the form REF,C1,C2, for example 'j2000,1h5m0.2s,+30d14m15s'. See the pyrap.measures documentation for more details.
parameters.name: center

parameters.info: Recompute the 'r' (radial distance from center) attribute of each source based on the current field  center. 'ref-freq'=MHz Set or change the reference frequency of the model.
parameters.name: refresh-r

parameters.info: Apply a primary beam expression to estimate apparent fluxes. Any valid Python expression using the variables 'r' and 'fq' is accepted. Use 'refresh' to re-estimate fluxes using the current expression. Example (for the WSRT-like 25m dish PB): 'cos(min(65*fq*1e-9*r,1.0881))**6'. OR: give a set of FITS primary beam patterns of the form e.g. FILENAME_$(xy)_$(reim).fits, these are the  same FITS files used in MeqTrees pybeams_fits.
parameters.name: primary-beam

parameters.info: Use XY basis correlations for beam filenames and Mueller matrices.
parameters.name: linear-pol

parameters.info: CTYPE for L axis in the FITS PB file. Note that our internal L points East (increasing RA), if the FITS beam axis points the opposite way, prefix the CTYPE with a '-'' character.
parameters.name: fits-l-axis

parameters.info: CTYPE for M axis in the FITS PB file. Note that our internal M points North (increasing Dec), if the FITS beam axis points the opposite way, prefix the CTYPE with a '-'' character.
parameters.name: fits-m-axis

parameters.info: Use given frequency (in MHz) for primary beam model, rather than the model reference frequency
parameters.name: beam-freq

parameters.info: when using a FITS beam, clip (power) beam gains at this level to keep intrinsic source fluxes from blowing up. Sources below this beamgain will be tagged 'nobeam'. Default: 0.001
parameters.name: beam-clip

parameters.info: perform a spectral index fit to each source based on a frequency dependent FITS beam, requires --primary-beam option to be used with a FITS file. Apply this spectral index to LSM sources. Must supply a band width (centred on --beam-freq) over which the beam spi is estimated
parameters.name: beam-spi

parameters.info: Apply beam-derived spectral indices even to sources without an intrinsic spectrum. Default is to only apply to sources that already have a spectrum. 'beam-nopol' apply intensity beam model only, ignoring polarization. Default is to use polarization. 'beam-diag' use diagonal Jones terms only for beam model. Default is to use all four terms if available.
parameters.name: force-beam-spi-wo-spectrum

parameters.info: Rotate the primary beam pattern through a parallactic angle (in degrees).
parameters.name: pa

parameters.info: Rotate the primary beam pattern through a range of parallactic angles (in degrees) and use the average value over PA.
parameters.name: pa-range

parameters.info: Rotate the primary beam pattern through a range of parallactic angles as given by the MS and take the average over time. This is more accurate than --pa-range.
parameters.name: pa-from-ms

parameters.info: Field ID for 'pa-from-ms' calculation
parameters.name: field-id

parameters.info: Correct approach to rotational averaging is to convert Jones(PA) to Mueller(PA), then average over PA. Tigger versions<=1.3.3 took the incorrect approach of averaging Jones over PA, then converting to Mueller. Use this option to mimic the old approach.
parameters.name: beam-average-jones

parameters.info: Distance parameter for source clustering, 0 to disable. Default is 60.
parameters.name: cluster-dist

parameters.info: Rename sources according to the COPART (cluster ordering, P.A., radial distance, type) scheme
parameters.name: rename

parameters.info: Size of one step in radial distance for the COPART scheme.
parameters.name: radial-step

parameters.info: Merge source clusters bearing the specified tags, replacing them with a single point source. Multiple tags may be given separated by commas. Use 'ALL' to merge all clusters.
parameters.name: merge-clusters

parameters.info: Prefix all source names with the given string
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.info: Removes the named source(s) from the model. NAME may contain * and ? wildcards.
parameters.name: remove-source

parameters.info: Shift the sky model from the nominal center to a different field center. COORDINATES specified as per the --center option.
parameters.name: recenter

parameters.info: Increase verbosity
parameters.name: verbose

parameters.info: use diagonal Jones terms only for beam model. Default is to use all four terms if available.
parameters.name: beam-diag

parameters.info: Enables various diagnostic plots
parameters.name: enable-plots
